column4: I rebooted my machine today and now I can't resolve domain names.  I can ping ip's and connect to my wireless network.  Any ideas on where to look? I never had to set my name servers or anything like that before
The name servers are set in /etc/resolv.conf
whats wierd is that I have a resolve.conf.tmp
Very odd.  Change it.  Drop the .tmp
what I try to move/copy it says "Input/output error"
Then you're doing it wrong?  sudo cp /etc/resolve.conf.tmp /etc/resolv.conf
then do that same command without sudo.  What error does it give?
maybe my USB is corrupt, this is live mode (persist)
It sounds that way to me.
i can't even ls -l resolv.conf to read the permissions.  Is it possible network manager left it open or has it open?
That file doesn't get locked.  Additionally you can ls -l a locked file.  Something is wrong the the FS on the flash drive.
